Authors: Benawa A., Ruman Y.S., Irawan I.
Title: Relevancy and Urgency of Religion Education on the Faithfulness Formation of the Students
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Mass Communication Program Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Character Building Development Center, Technic Information Program, School of Technic Information, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Benawa, A., Character Building Development Center, Mass Communication Program Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ruman, Y.S., Character Building Development Center, Mass Communication Program Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Irawan, I., Character Building Development Center, Technic Information Program, School of Technic Information, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The main objective of this research is to observe the extent of students' understanding of Pancasila Education, especially the first principle, Ketuhanan Yang Maha Esa and Religion Education towards the formation of Faithfulness of the Students. For this reason the method used is a quantitative research method which is carried out by distributing questionnaires to the respondents and then completing it by using path analysis. The results showed that Pancasila Education, especially the First Principle has no significant influence. It can be seen on the amounted 34,30%, while the effect of Religion Education on the Faithfulness Formation of the students is significant, which amounted to 59.4%. It can be concluded that Pancasila Education has smaller significant effect on the Faithfulness Formation of the students than Religion Education, which has significant effect. From the results of this study it became clear about the study of what types of education had a significant influence on the formation of the Faitfulness of the students. And the implication is that Religion Education should be delivered more intensively and seriously if we idealized to format faitfulness of our students as the young generation. Therefore, the students as the young generation not only having religion, but they have to be religious and faithful persons. © 2020 IOP Publishing Ltd. All rights reserved.
Index Keywords: Regression analysis; Surveys; First principles; Path analysis; Quantitative research methods; Students
References: Benawa, The Effect of Pancasila Education and Civic Education on Nationalist Character of the Students (2019) Advances in Social Science, Education and Humanities Research, 353, pp. 347-351; Kansil, (1986) Pendidikan Pancasila di Perguruan Tinggi; Frederikus, F., (2017) Character Building Pancasila; Arcadius, B., (2016) Iman Tiga Dimensi-Model Beriman Secara Kritis; Magnis-Suseno, (1987) Etika Umum; Frederikus, F., (2015) Character Building Agama; Donald, A., Lucy Cheser, J., Asghar Reza, W., (1997) Introduction to Research in Education; Slovin, (2010) Principles and Methods of Research: Ariola et Al; Montgomery, D.C., (2012) Design and Analysis of Experiments
Conference name: 2nd International Conference on Environmental Geography and Geography Education, ICEGE 2019
Abbreviated Source Title: IOP Conf. Ser. Earth Environ. Sci.

Title: The information technology developer as an actor in the sociological approach
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Character Building and Development Center in Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Faculty of Humanities in Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ruman, Y.S., Character Building and Development Center in Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Oktriono, K., Faculty of Humanities in Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: The article aims to punctuate the role of sociology in developing critical literacies study of information technology. In this set, it described the social aspects that affected the developers and users in information technology. The approaches in sociology study explained the inherently social aspect. The study ushered the readers based on the approach of functionalism sociological perspective. In this approach, developers and users of information technology served as social actors whose actions are influenced by social factors. Social factors structurally limit and enable a developer and user to create, develop, shape, or utilize information technology. The study involved IT designers or developers based on a literature study. The analysis accentuated the threshold of experiential, subjective meaning attachment in the study. As a result, the study offers valuable insight to predispose social actors in evolving behavioural and the utilization of information technology. © IJSTR 2020.
Author Keywords: Critical literacies; Information; Social actor; Sociology; Technology
Funding Text 1: The authors wish to thank to Binus University. This work was supported in part by RTTO grant.

Authors: Siregar C., Pane M.M., Ruman Y.S.
Title: The virtual team performance in solving teamwork conflict problems
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University Jalan Anggrek, Cakra No.1A, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Siregar, C., Bina Nusantara University Jalan Anggrek, Cakra No.1A, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pane, M.M., Bina Nusantara University Jalan Anggrek, Cakra No.1A, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ruman, Y.S., Bina Nusantara University Jalan Anggrek, Cakra No.1A, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aimed to know the ability of Binus Online Learning (BOL) students as a virtual team in solving their teamwork conflict problems, especially when they have to complete team assignments. This study uses Tuckman theory of teamwork (known as team stages model or FSNP) as the main theoretical basis for reference [1, 2]. This study uses a quantitative method with interview randomly among the students to clarify the subject matter mainly focuses on 131 students as the respondents which are identified as the millennial generation (born 1981-2000, based on Reeves and Oh, 2008)[3] considering their fluency in using Information and Communication Technology (ICT). To measure the ability of respondents in solving teamwork conflict problems based on online learning system in BOL, Likert scale is used on a scale of 1 to 5 with corrected item-total correlations 0.49, and α 0.81 (> 0.5). The result shows scale 1 was chosen by 17.20%, scale 2 was 15.53%, scale 3 was 31.90%, scale 4 was 24.99%, and scale 5 was selected by 10.28% of respondents. It concluded that the virtual team performance of BOL in solving teamwork conflict problems is average (tend to be moderate to high). © 2018 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Binus online learning; Learning management system.; Solving teamwork conflict problems; Virtual team performance
Index Keywords: E-learning; Education computing; Human resource management; Students; Information and Communication Technologies; Learning management system; On-line learning systems; Online learning; Quantitative method; Solving teamwork conflict problems; Team assignment; Virtual team; Problem solving

Authors: Pane M.M., Siregar C., Ruman Y.S., Rumeser J.A.A.
Title: The application of the Lencioni model in online learning: A case study in higher education
Affiliations: Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Communication Science, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Psychology, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pane, M.M., Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Siregar, C., Communication Science, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ruman, Y.S., Communication Science, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Rumeser, J.A.A., Psychology, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The study aimed to understand the performance of students‟ abilities of leadership in conflict solving problems for undertaking the virtual teamwork in online learning using the Lencioni Model. The study adapted the quantitative method. The respondents amounted 131 students of four departments from online learning program with a different range of semesters. The study measured the teamwork effectiveness performance associated to the Lencioni Model of the respondents using the online learning management system with the Likert scale on the scale of 1 to 5 with corrected item-total correlations 0.49, and α 0.81 (> 0.5). The performance of teamwork effectiveness is moderate for most of respondents. It concludes that the teamwork abilities in the virtual teamwork of online learning students in Binus pinpoint on the awareness of the five dysfunctions of a team contribution using the Lencioni Model. © 2018 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Online learning; Teamwork effectiveness; The Lencioni Model; Virtual teamwork
Index Keywords: Education computing; Human resource management; Students; Conflict solving; Higher education; Likert scale; Online learning; Quantitative method; Teamwork effectiveness; Virtual teamwork; E-learning

Authors: Kusumajati D.A., Ruman Y.S., Oktriono K.
Title: The influence of lecturers' competencies towards students' performance motivation: A case study at higher education
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Symposium on Educational Technology, ISET 2017
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Information System, Indonesia; Communication Studies Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Language Center, Tourism Destination Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kusumajati, D.A., Character Building Development Center, Information System, Indonesia; Ruman, Y.S., Communication Studies Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Oktriono, K., Language Center, Tourism Destination Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Abstract: The research aims to examine the influence of lecturers' competences towards student achievement motivation. By knowing the relationship lectures' competencies and performance motivation, researchers intend to provide feedback for Bina Nusantara University towards the development of lecturers' competencies and motivation. The competencies of the lecturers are the external factors that bolster students' motivation to perform appropriately. The research was quantitative-based approach and engaging 30 respondents of Bina Nusantara University students. The results showed that the influence of lecturers' competency towards students' performance motivation counted for 34.4%. It signified that 65.6% contribution is based on other factors. Lecturers' competencies, that predisposed high impact towards students' performance motivation, comprised of social, pedagogic, and personality competencies. The subsequent studies are recommended to be explored in depth. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Bins; Education; Educational technology; Motivation; Teaching; Achievement; Competencies; External factors; High impact; Higher education; Lecturers; Student achievement; University students; Students

Authors: Pane M.M., Ruman Y.S., Irawan I.
Title: The role of instant messaging in building virtual teamwork: A case study of character education in Binus University
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 10th International Conference on Human System Interactions, HSI 2017
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Management Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pane, M.M., Computer Science Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ruman, Y.S., Management Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Irawan, I., Computer Science Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Teamwork is considered as an important competency in the era of information technology. Communications are predominantly doing virtually. The study aims to measure the role of instant messaging in building vitual teamwork. The study posited convenience sampling technique and quantitative method-based applying the measurement of frequency for managing and interpreting the data. The respondents involved students of sophomores, 5th and 7th semester students. The study populated 120 respondents consisting of students from many department such as Information Technology, Psychology, Visual Communication Design-Animation, Business Law, and Information System, Accounting-IS, IS-Management, Accounting, International Relations, English Literature, Game Application Technology (GAT), and Marketing Communication. It measured the teamwork competencies performance of the respondents using the instant messaging using the Likert scale on the scale of 1 to 5. The performance is: scale 4 is chosen by 40.05% respondents, scale 3 is 29.35%, the scale 2 is 14.12%, the scale 5 is 12.27%, and the scale 1 is just chosen by 4.21% of respondents. The result of the study indicated that the role of instant messaging (IM) discorded with expected role. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Character education; Instant messaging; Virtual teamwork
Index Keywords: Animation; E-learning; Education; Information management; Marketing; Message passing; Visual communication; Application technologies; Instant messaging; International relations; Marketing communications; Quantitative method; Sampling technique; Virtual teamwork; Visual communication designs; Students

Authors: Kusumajati D.A., Ruman Y.S., Anwar R., Oktriono K.
Title: The perception of cultural value towards college students: A case study in higher education
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 10th International Conference on Human System Interactions, HSI 2017
Affiliations: Information System Department, Character Building Development Center, United States; Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, United States; Language Center, Tourism Destination Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kusumajati, D.A., Information System Department, Character Building Development Center, United States; Ruman, Y.S., Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, United States; Anwar, R., Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, United States; Oktriono, K., Language Center, Tourism Destination Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Abstract: The study aims to measure Bina Nusantara University students? perception towards cultural value. Dimensions of gauged cultural value consisted of five indicators, namely power distance, uncertainty avoidance, individualism vs. collectivity, masculinity vs. femininity, and long-term orientation vs. short-term orientation. The study oriented to provide input for the organization upon the perception of students? cultural value. Cultural values are the guidelines of organized community life and influence human behavior toward the environment. This study was conducted on 95 students of Bina Nusantara University. The results indicated that students embraced an auspicious understanding of cultural values. Based on the research, it uncovered that students retained a quite high understanding of cultural values on the dimensions of individualism vs. collectivism and masculinity vs. femininity. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Bins; Sensory perception; College; College students; Cultural value; Higher education; Human behaviors; Long-term orientation; Uncertainty avoidance; University students; Students

Title: The potent role of information technology in todays Indonesian democracy
Source title: 2017 3rd International Conference on Information Management, ICIM 2017
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ruman, Y.S., Character Building Development Center, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Pane, M.M., Character Building Development Center, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: This article shows that information technology has been advanced as an instrument for democracy in Indonesia. It means that democracy is now not only depending on the formal institution like a political party or legislative institution. This elite model and conventional of citizen participation has moved to a populist model by information technology. On one hand, every citizen by individually or collectively could participate in anywhere or time to influence the public policy. They also interact actively to their political leader, their represent or government in whole. And then, on the other hand, the government could deliver the public policies directly and quickly. By using the subjective meaning methodology, this article will describe how the information technology influences the political elite on one hand and citizens on the other hand in Indonesia politics. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Social sciences; Citizen participation; Democracy; Digital; Indonesia; Political parties; Potent role; Representative; Public policy

Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Kemanggisan–Palmerah, West Jakarta, Indonesia; Gea, A.A., Character Building Development Center, Binus University, Jl. Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Kemanggisan–Palmerah, West Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Student learning achievement can be determined by student factors, teaching factors, and educational systems as whole. The concern of this research is based on student factors, especially the motivation of students to learn. There are many factors to motivate students to learn and one of them is learning interest. This research proposes to describe the contribution of learning interests against the learning motivation. To describe this contribution, this research chooses Character Building Course at Binus University as a study case. All students at Binus University have to take Character Building class. This research described how student’s interest correlated with the motivation of the students in learning Character Building. Based on the quantitative method, this research concluded that there is a correlation between a student’s interest and the student’s motivation in learning Character Building Course. The contribution of the student’s interest against the student’s motivation in learning Character Building is 9.7%. Because of the correlation is very weak, this research recommended to undergo advancing research that based on multiple variable both internal and external motivation, either on student’s level, lecturer, learning facility, teaching learning activities or learning system as whole. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers.
References: Hurst, J., Carbone, A., Mitchell, I., Gunstone, A.M., (2009) An Exploration of Internal Factors Influencing Student Learning of Programming, , http://crpit.com/confpapers/CRPITV95Carbone.pdf; Ormrod, J.E., (2011) Educational Psychology, Developing Learners, , 7th edn., Pearson, Boston; Santrock, J., (2008) Educational Psychology, , 3rd edn., The McGraw Hill Companies, Inc., New York; Schiefele, U., (1991) Educational Psychologist, 26, p. 299; Krapp, A., (1999) European Journal of Psychology of Education 1999, 14, p. 23; Djamrah, S.B., (2008) Psikologi Belajar, , Edisi 2, Rineka Cipta, Jakarta; Syah, M., (2006) Psikologi Belajar, , Raja Grafindo Persada, Jakarta
